stimulusHtml: Two identical conducting spheres are on insulating stands, as shown in the figure. The spheres have been given charges +q1 and -q2, which have opposite signs and different magnitudes; i.e., +q1≠|−q2|. The spheres are brought together to make contact and are then separated again. Which of the following correctly describes the electric force between the spheres before and after they make contact with each other?
choicesHtml: The force is attractive at first and then becomes repulsive.
The force is repulsive at first and then becomes attractive.
The force is attractive both before and after the spheres make contact.
The force is repulsive both before and after the spheres make contact.
